cyclone.name: LAURA
cyclone.current_location: about 360 mi SSE of Lake Charles, Louisiana
cyclone.trajectory: expected to turn northwest today, make landfall along the upper Texas–southwest Louisiana coast, then arc north across Arkansas and curve northeast through the Tennessee and Ohio Valleys before exiting off the Mid-Atlantic coast by Sunday
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: upper Texas / southwest Louisiana coast near the TX-LA border (around Cameron–Lake Charles area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch east of Intracoastal City to west of Morgan City, LA; Storm Surge Watch Freeport TX to San Luis Pass TX and Mouth of the Mississippi River to Ocean Springs MS, including area lakes
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning San Luis Pass TX to Intracoastal City LA; Storm Surge Warning San Luis Pass TX to Mouth of the Mississippi River; Tropical Storm Warning Sargent TX to San Luis Pass TX and east of Intracoastal City LA to Mouth of the Mississippi River
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Upper Texas and southwest Louisiana coastline with hazards extending inland across LA, AR, MS, and into the lower Mississippi Valley
weather_observation.wind: Occasional gusty winds (20–30 mph) possible Saturday as remnant low passes south of Lake Erie
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–2 inches of rain possible late Friday into Saturday from remnant moisture could cause brief localized ponding
weather_observation.other_hazards: Low risk of an isolated tornado in southern Ohio Saturday, minor river rises possible but major impacts to port operations are not expected
